page.title: 01INTRODUCTION TO DONCASTER
page.content: THE ROMANS BUILT A MILITARY FORT IN 71 AD. AND CALLED IT 'DANUM'.IT WAS NEAR A FORD ACROSS THE RIVER DON.LATER THE NORMANS BUILT A CASTLE ON THE SITE OF THE FORT.IN THE DOMESDAY BOOK ARE MENTIONED DUNECASTRE(DONCASTER),AND ITS PRESENT DAY BUILT-UP DISTRICTS OF HESTORP(HEXTHORPE)AND WATELAGE (WHEATLEY) WHICH FORM A LARGE PART OF THE 1985 'D'BLOCK.THE COUNTRY TOWN OF DONCASTER GREW UP TO BE AN INDUSTRIAL CENTRE WITH THE COMING OF THE RAILWAYS IN 1849. MODERN DONCASTER SERVES A WIDE SURROUNDING AREA OF SOUTH YORKSHIRE AND ADJACENT COUNTIES AND HAS A LARGE POPULATION.IT IS A SHOPPING AND MARKET CENTRE,A MINING AND INDUSTRIAL AREA SURROUNDED BY FLAT FARMING LAND. DONCASTER IS CENTRALLY PLACED WITHIN THE COUNTRY AND IS SERVED BY GOOD ROAD AND RAIL LINKS IN ALL DIRECTIONS.
